text: Hi all, If i have more than one blog, how do i access the blogposts under that blog via graphql

Yup, serverless functions are enterprise only (:smiling_face_with_tear:).

You can upload a JSON file via `hs upload` and reference it (<//99161133.fs1.HubSpotusercontentqa-na1.net/hubfs/99161133/raw_assets/public/Debugging/test.json|example>). But you would only be able to access that in the browser and not serverside
Did something recently change about how imports work between maybe Friday and today? It looks like an import of `import "swiper/css";` is no longer loading CSS properly
^ this is not critical urgent but it is blocking me at the moment. It looks like that import breaks in production but not over proxy. Any ideas?

Hello All,
I’m using the <https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-js-building-block-examples/tree/main/hello-world> to build a project.
And I’m getting the following when trying to deploy using an await top level function, already tested changing the target in the vite config, any ideas?
```Top-level await is not available in the configured target environment ("chrome87", "edge88", "es2020", "firefox78", "safari14" + 3 overrides)```
:wave: we don’t currently support customization of vite configs. is your top level await in a module that is within an island?

No, its in the partials folder, I’m using the “Cars.jsx” to build the partial I want as example.

To solve this without changing the configuration I was moving the function inside the component when the component loads using useEffect, but useEffect is not triggering when I load the page. Even a simple console log does not trigger. Any ideas about this other issue?

I had no problem with the previous react boilerplate, but not sure why this one is not working for me
a `useEffect` won’t run in the root component of a partial because it only runs on the server - you’ll need an island for any effects to run in the browser
is the async function fetching data?
:+1: for now an island + `useEffect` is the best approach then, we’re working on ways to improve data fetching outside of effects on the client
this channel will be updated when that is available!
Great! Thanks Ben I’ll test that approach!
